name: Role
shortDesc: Creates an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role. An IAM role can be used to enable applications running on an Amazon EC2 instance to securely access your AWS resources.

properties.name: AssumeRolePolicyDocument
properties.desc: The IAM assume role policy that is associated with this role.

properties.name: ManagedPolicyArns
properties.desc: One or more managed policy ARNs to attach to this role.

properties.name: Path
properties.desc: The path associated with this role. For information about IAM paths, see Friendly Names and Paths in IAM User Guide.

properties.name: Policies
properties.desc: The policies to associate with this role. Policies can also be specified externally. For sample templates that demonstrates both embedded and external policies, see Template Examples.

attributes.name: Arn
attributes.desc: Returns the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the instance profile. For example:{"Fn::GetAtt" : ["MyRole", "Arn"] }This will return a value such as “arn:aws:iam::1234567890:role/MyRole-AJJHDSKSDF”.
